summary: Experienced Executive with a demonstrated history of working in the biopharmaceutical industry. Strong professional skilled in Commercial Leadership, Sales, Marketing, Oncology and Specialty Care.
headline: Executive Healthcare Professional - Global, US & Canada

message.text:
Merci Première ligne en santé/First Line in Health pour une discussion passionnante sur l'importance de la santé durable avec Yanick Labrie, le Dr Alexander Singer et Eva Villalba, M.B.A., MSc., VBHC Green Belt. Durant le panel, nous avons parlé des pressions inouïes qui s'exercent sur le système de santé du Québec et de l'importance de cibler les ressources financières limitées là où elles sont le plus nécessaires.
 
Nous savons que nos systèmes de santé sont mis à rude épreuve et que les défis peuvent sembler considérables, mais nous avons convenu ensemble que nous avons besoin d'une approche stratégique du financement qui donne la priorité à la prévention et aux résultats en matière de santé. Je pense que cela signifie qu'il faut réimaginer la prestation des soins de santé et les rôles que les principaux acteurs de la santé peuvent jouer - en tirant parti de nos forces uniques - afin d'offrir les meilleurs soins possibles aux patients.
 
Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur les recommandations concrètes visant à améliorer le réseau de santé québécois dans le cadre des grandes réformes en cours, lisez ce qui suit ici: https://lnkd.in/gtvGqaJG
 
#VBHC #PHSSR #AstraZeneca 
 
**********

Thank you Première ligne en santé/First Line in Health for an engaging discussion on the importance of sustainable health alongside Yanick Labrie, Dr. Alexander Singer and Eva Villalba, M.B.A., MSc., VBHC Green Belt. During the panel discussion, we spoke about the incredible pressures on the Quebec healthcare system and the importance of targeting scarce financial resources where they’re needed most.
 
We know our healthcare systems are strained and the challenges may seem daunting, but together agreed that we need a strategic approach to funding that prioritizes prevention and health outcomes. I believe this means reimagining healthcare delivery and the roles that key health stakeholders can play – leveraging our unique strengths – to deliver on the best possible care for patients.
 
If you’re interested in learning more about concrete recommendations to improve the Quebec healthcare network within the context of the major reforms underway, take a read here: https://lnkd.in/gHbg8pcQ

#VBHC #PHSSR #AstraZeneca

I am humbled and privileged by the opportunity to work with talented leaders across the Canadian biopharmaceutical industry to improve patient health and make a positive contribution for people, society and the planet.

AstraZeneca Canada’s Country President, Gaby Bourbara, has been selected as a new member of Innovative Medicines Canada - Médicaments novateurs Canada's (IMC) Board of Directors. With more than 22 years’ experience in the Canadian and global biopharmaceutical industry, Gaby is a long-standing champion of the life sciences sector and the critical role it plays in driving health innovation to improve patient outcomes, and as an engine of economic growth and high technology jobs.

I’m incredibly proud of the leadership role AstraZeneca is embracing in sustainability, globally and right here in Canada. As a company, we’re committed to driving positive change beyond the impact of our medicines – tackling some of the most pressing sustainability issues of our time for the health of people, society and planet. We also believe in the incredible power of individuals to make a big difference when it comes to addressing critical sustainability challenges. Across Canada, inspiring youth leaders are driving positive change every day – from improving access to healthcare in remote and indigenous communities, to supporting reforestation in response to the recent wildfires, to pursing social justice for historically marginalized and underrepresented communities.  
 
As part of AstraZeneca’s commitment to building a healthier world for future generations, and in partnership with Plan International Canada  we’ve just launched the Eureka Fellowship for Youth Changemakers in Canada – an initiative that aims to empower and support the next generation of youth sustainability leaders, including supporting their participation at the 2024 One Young World Summit in Montreal. Check out the post below to learn more and how to apply! 
 
Gena Restivo  Carlo Mastrangelo  Plan International Canada  Lindsay Glassco  Anjum Sultana MPH (She/Her)

We're committed to driving positive change beyond the impact of our medicines – helping to address some of the most pressing sustainability issues of our time for the health of people, society and planet. Today we’ve announced, in partnership with Plan International Canada, the national launch of the Eureka Fellowship for Youth Changemakers in Canada (Eureka Fellowship) – a national program that seeks to empower and amplify the impact of inspiring youth sustainability leaders across the country. 

The Eureka Fellowship is looking for 13 motivated youth who are actively working to tackle Canadian and global modern-day sustainability challenges – from access to healthcare & health equity, to environmental protection & climate action, to diversity, equity & inclusion – to join its first-ever cohort of youth sustainability leaders. Named recipients will receive full support to attend the 2024 One Young World Summit in Montreal, where they will receive further mentorship and capacity-building opportunities to accelerate the change they are making. The One Young World Summit is an annual global event that connects the world’s most impactful young leaders to create a better, more sustainable and equitable world – bringing together representatives from more than 190 countries.

Are you or someone you know making a great impact for people, society and the planet? Applications for the Eureka Fellowship are now open, and close at 11:59 p.m. EST on April 23, 2024. 

For more information or to apply, please visit: https://lnkd.in/eMxxyJKP 
#OYW24 #EurekaFellowshipYC

One Young World

International Women’s Day (IWD) gives the world an opportunity to celebrate women – those who have pioneered change in the past, who have helped shape our present, and who are critical to creating a better, healthier, more equitable future.

This year’s theme is #InspireInclusion, and it’s a call to action I take to heart. Every day I’m inspired by the women around me, including my wife and daughters, who are fearless and strong in their own unique ways. By the women I have the good fortune to work alongside at AstraZeneca. And the changemakers, regardless of how they identify, who are working hard to make the world a better, more equitable place for everyone.

Gena Restivo, our VP Corporate Affairs & Sustainability, is one of those women – a strong leader, powerful role model, and constant champion of the diverse and inclusive culture we nurture at AZC. I encourage you to read Gena’s article, where she shares her thoughts on International Women’s Day and the incredible ‘power of potential’.

#IWD2024

To say I’m filled with gratitude this International Women's Day would be an understatement. Yesterday, I had the privilege of attending an event sponsored by AstraZeneca Canada celebrating 140 years of extraordinary contributions to women’s health in Canada and around the world made by the trailblazers at Women's College Hospital. If that event and what it honoured wasn’t enough to inspire, I also had the privilege of spending time with some of the Hospital’s Future Leaders – individuals recognized for their impact and vision – as well as some of our valued partners, each committed to leading the way to a better, healthier, more equitable world in their own way.
So, am I grateful? Absolutely. In awe? For sure. Inspired? Yup. And most of all, more determined than ever to make a difference where I can – be it elevating the women around me, challenging the status quo to create more inclusive and diverse workplaces, or advocating for more equitable access to healthcare. 
Equity matters. And it takes all of us to make it a reality. 

Read my thoughts here:  https://lnkd.in/ekPQ6xt2

#InternationalWomensDay  #GirlsBelongHere  

Angela ThompsonKelley JamesHeather McDonald, PhDAlison SimpsonGaby BourbaraAlex Romanovschi, MDErik SchraderDaniel Smedley, MBA,CPA,CMA

I’m excited to share that as of March 1, I’ve taken on the role of President at AstraZeneca Canada.

When I started with this incredible company more than 22 years ago, I could never have imagined this amazing journey I have been on. Working across Canada, the U.S. and global markets, I have witnessed the impact that innovation can have on patient care and I firmly believe in the power of science to change lives. 

That belief is shared by more than 1,650 diverse employees at AstraZeneca Canada, who strive each and every day to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines across our core therapy areas – from severe asthma and Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) to lupus, breast and lung cancer to COVID-19.

As a proud Canadian, I'm incredibly honoured to work with everyone across AstraZeneca Canada to continue to nurture our dynamic and inclusive culture, to transform and improve care for Canadian patients, and to foster our sustainability commitment to making a positive impact for people, society, and our planet.

commentary.text: Thank you for making the trip to connect with us and our growing team at AstraZeneca! Looking forward to continued discussions on partnerships to better serve patients.
Congrats Karen! Looking forward to working together again! 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼
